title: Ignition Coils - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
The ignition coil harnesses are identified by coloured tape as follows:
Note the routing and position of the six wires connected to the ignition coils for installation.
Note the routings of the high tension cables for installation.
Disconnect the six wires from the ignition coils.
Remove and discard the fixings securing the ignition coils to their brackets. discard the fixings.
Ignition coil connections (Number one cylinder) [white tape]
Ignition coil connections (Number two cylinder) [red tape]
Ignition coil connections (Number three cylinder) [ blue tape]
Disconnect the high tension cables from the spark plugs and remove the ignition coils.
If required, detach the electrical connector and brake line clamp from the ignition coils bracket. Discard the fixing.
Remove and discard the fixings on the right hand side of the ignition coils bracket.
Remove the fixing on the left hand side and remove the ignition coils bracket. Discard the fixing.

Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Perform the following operations:
Seat - Removal
Battery - Removal
Fuel Tank - Removal
Evaporative Canister - Removal
The ignition coil harnesses are identified by coloured tape as follows:
White - Number one cylinder
Red - Number two cylinder
Blue - Number three cylinder
Note the routing and position of the six wires connected to the ignition coils for installation.
Note the routings of the high tension cables for installation.
Disconnect the six wires from the ignition coils.
Remove and discard the fixings securing the ignition coils to their brackets. discard the fixings.

Ignition coil connections (Number two cylinder) [red tape]
Ignition coil connections (Number three cylinder) [ blue tape]
Fixings
Disconnect the high tension cables from the spark plugs and remove the ignition coils.
If required, detach the electrical connector and brake line clamp from the ignition coils bracket. Discard the fixing.
Remove and discard the fixings on the right hand side of the ignition coils bracket.
